pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c7f57e5dee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16032/commits/c7f57e5dee8bbe58b3fa3a7a8f89f388efc42ad7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_symm_iff_trans_eq_refl`
`+ mul_eq_one_iff_eq_inv'`
`+ mul_eq_one_iff_inv_eq'`
`+ symm_eq_iff_trans_eq_refl`
`+ trans_eq_refl_iff_eq_symm`
`+ trans_eq_refl_iff_symm_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks! Please fix names (see suggestions above), wait for the CI, then merge.
bors d+

:v: Rida-Hamadani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10872470869/job/30167523858)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10872470869/job/30167524003)

Two requests:

* I think this is really just a variant of `mul_eq_one_iff_eq_inv` (on general groups) with the multiplication the other way around. Can you add that lemma?
* Can you generalize this to `Equiv` rather than `Equiv.perm`, by using `Equiv.refl` instead of `1`?

```suggestion
theorem trans_eq_refl_iff_eq_symm (f :   ) (g :   ) :
```

The heading for this section is
```
/-! Lemmas about mixing `Perm` with `Equiv`. Because we have multiple ways to express
`Equiv.refl`, `Equiv.symm`, and `Equiv.trans`, we want simp lemmas for every combination.
The assumption made here is that if you're using the group structure, you want to preserve it after
simp. -/
```
since this is (rightfully?) not a simp lemma, I think probably we don't want this lemma at all. Downstream, you should use either `mul_eq_one_iff_eq_inv'` directly or `trans_eq_refl_iff_eq_symm`

Here's a golf if you put this at line 497 after `symm_comp_eq`:
```
theorem trans_eq_refl_iff_eq_symm (f :   ) (g :   ) :
    f.trans g = Equiv.refl   f = g.symm := by
  rw [ Equiv.coe_inj, coe_trans, coe_refl,  eq_symm_comp, comp_id, Equiv.coe_inj]
```
This is nice, thank you.
Why did you make this change?
The test was failing, I will revert this change and wait for the CI to see if it still fails now.
The test still fails without this change, [507b3a5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16032/commits/507b3a5cad74511cfeb084e9b1dab0145654a75c).
It looks like the test is non-deterministic: it can decide to `rw [sub_eq_neg_add]` instead of `rw [sub_eq_add_neg]`, then fail.

We have four variants of this theorem for `mul_eq_one`, so probably we should have the same thing for this lemma.

Can you also make the `f` and `g` arguments implicit to match?
I suggest that we don't add these 2 versions. One can always use `rw [ _]` or `_.symm` with the previous theorems.
How do you plan to use these lemmas? Can you just use `rw [mul_eq_one_iff_inv_eq, eq_comm]` instead?

This lemma and the one you ask about in the previous comment were both added due to suggestions by Eric, the context is [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16032#discussion_r1725944729) and [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16032#discussion_r1737282636).
OK, let's leave them.

```suggestion
theorem eq_symm_iff_trans_eq_refl {f :   } {g :   } :
```

```suggestion
theorem symm_eq_iff_trans_eq_refl {f :   } {g :   } :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/Perm): composition of permutations is 1 iff they are inverses
